The whole team at the clinic were so friendly and professional from the start of my consultation to having my procedure to my final visit in fact it was like a day out !! I would recommend any of the team one word GREAT

I went to the Leeds practice of The Wellness Clinic and I have been really impressed with their service and competence from the moment I telephoned to make the appointment for the initial consultation. I was looking at their FUE treatment for hair replacement. I had been for a different hair replacement operation in the past at a different clinic which had left me with scarring so I was slightly apprehensive about what could be done for me now. From the moment I walked through the door all the staff were very professional and reassuring. The FUE treatment was fully explained and I was put completely in the picture as to my choices - at no time was I put under any pressure and never felt like they were profit driven, the patient's needs are a priority.  On the day of the operation everything went very smoothly and I could not believe the ease of the procedure and the lack of pain and trauma and hardly any wounds to heal - fantastic!  Dr Mark Tam was my consultant and I cannot fault anything that has been carried out during my treatment and applaud his team. They have given me back not just a head of hair but bucketfuls of confidence. I feel greatly boosted and I am no longer self conscious about how my hair looks. It is life changing and I appreciate all the skill and passion of the staff in Leeds. Thank you so much.

All staff at the Bristol clinic were extremely welcoming & friendly, I felt instantly at ease. My treatment was explained to me really well both before, during & after (Dermal fillers in my lips). Lesley talked me through every step of the way. I am so pleased with my results, the outcome is exactly as I was hoping for.
I had Vaser lipo at the Bristol site last September.

review_title: Great staff, made me feel at ease
review_body: Will definately use again. Went to the Leeds clinic. They were friendly and reassuring and had time for me even though they were really busy.

I was very impressed with all aspects of the service. The atmosphere is informal, friendly even; the clinical aspects were first class; and it wasn't overly expensive either. I have already recommended The Wellness Clinic to friends.

I cannot recommend the privet clinic enough, this is my second procedure with the clinic and both times I received excellent customer care, pre, during and post-surgery.  Dr Grant Hamelt is truly skilled at his profession.  I had Vaser Lipo on my thighs and I?��m amazed at the difference.  What I really liked about Dr Hamlet is that he really listens to your concerns and puts your mind at ease, giving you realistic expectations.  The results really speak for themselves however, I?��m 6 weeks post op, all the bruising and swelling from the procedure has now gone and I?��m loving my new shape, everything fits better which has improved my confidence enormously, no more wobbly bits! Massive thanks to Dr Hamlet and The Wellness Clinic!

I've been using the leeds based part of The Wellness Clinic for procedures , I first went to them maybe 18 mths ago & was given a full & honest opinion on what I wanted . One of the main points I liked was that I was actually talked out of having things done I didn't need rather than them wanting to take as much money as possible. After carefully consideration 6 mths after my first meeting I went back & used there services I have since used them over the last 14 mths for both minor & major procedures & am very happy with everything all the staff are amazing. Ask for Sorena your main contact the lady couldn't do enough to help.

I had a derma-roller and laser skin treatment (not sure on the technical name!) this was the first of a number of sessions to reduce acne scarring; on arrival I was greeted in a modern, professional and warm environment by the Clinic Manager who explained my treatment to me fully before I met my Practitioner.

review_title: vasor lipo flanks, fat transfer chest
review_body: Overall staff were very professional aswell as helpful throughout the whole experience. First class service. The only thing I would mention is I think my treatment area and expected result for fat transfer to chest was not clearly explained enough. I think surgeon was over confident. Don't get me wrong my surgeon was top class. Don't know if I'm aloud to give his name but I am gonna anyway, it was Dr Grant. He is very very experienced but I think he could have thought out the procedure to chest a bit more. Results have made a huge difference, but could have been better with a little more thought. Doctors attitude towards treatment and patient was very positive. Very helpful. After care from Doctor and nurses was 5 star. Can't fault it. If chest results were a little better I would have given 5 stars. But still worth every penny. Thankyou Private Clinic.

was offered a course of 4 treatments for my skin as always suffered with bad acne, I had these 4 treatments 1 each month. everytime I had a treatment I seen an improvement I have now finished my treatment and I am so happy with the outcome. The Wellness Clinic made me feel very comfortable and each person I met there was always very friendly and excellent at there job.

A few years ago I was diagnosed with a rare form of Skin Cancer which had grown into my eyebrow. After scans and tests I was told that this had grown under my eyebrow and that the eyebrow had to be removed. The cancer was successfully removed first time in an NHS hospital and I was provided with a skin graft to the area but was told that in order to get my eyebrow hairs back I would have to look elsewhere as the NHS do not provide this type of surgery. I knew that it was time to look at getting treatment privately.

review_title: Highest integrity, keeping the customers best interests in mind
review_body: Met Lisa - who provided the most honest and open session I have received when it comes to hair loss. Actually recommended against doing procedures at this stage. Quite unbelievable to see an organization sacrifice short term profit for long term customer satisfaction. Strongly recommend.

I was very happy with the level of care and professionalism I recieved from The Wellness Clinic. Staff were happy and willing to answer all of my questions and concerns and made me feel very comfortable.

I had been thinking of having liposuction for two years and after a lot of research I decided to go with The Wellness Clinic in April 2015. I wont mention names. Both doctors I talked to where very nice and I was confident I was going for the best option. The day of the surgery I was made to seat out front for a full two hours waiting,after I arrived on time. Finally when the surgeon came through I got changed and he quickly drew on with the marker I told him my concerns and he told me all will be taken care of. Everything seemed so rushed for such a body altering procedure.I went into the surgery room and some time later I was woken up. Literally made to stand on my own without much support I was so dizzy I almost fell over from the sedation but I guess they had to have another patient in ASAP,so I had to be taken off the surgery bed,the vaser fluid was going everywhere even after changing into the compression garment.I felt like a barnyard animal,not a human in a hospital after surgery. You would think after paying 13000 GBP cheap cotton would be available ! They literally wanted me out. After checking my pressure and my shoes soaked with blood running from the different holes in my body,I waited another 45 mins for a prescription. By this time I was close to tears sitting alone in the after surgery room,no nurse checking if youre fine or need anything. As if that is not enough, 7 months later the final shape was irregular flanks,deformed buttocks,one thigh bigger than the other in a very obvious way,scars,my inner thigh more obvious than ever as the surgeon was to much of in a hurry to get the next patient,so why bother with the complicated parts of the surgery,I had ALL the inner thigh fat intact,he didnt even try ! I HAD NO follow up what so ever,only emails advertising more treatments ! Frankly I do not need or even want an apology or explanation because I will never go back to that clinic again,but just shared to help another girl that worked hard for her to finally have a procedure,so they can make an informed choice. I have been so depressed,I feel like I was robbed of not only money but a year of my life as I just didnt feel good about myself. I have had to spend another 10 000GBP to get a revision this month and already have some  of my spark back. Am sorry but all they want is your money,they dont care about you as a patient.That was my impresson.

I got there for a wrinkle injection for two parts of the face, however, one part did not turn out that nicely, so after waiting for 2 weeks until the Botox came to his full effect I tried to schedule a top-up. However, I got told, that none of the doctors are available until in 3 weeks time and that I was too late, because I should have come within the 2 weeks. I am doing Botox injections since 2 years now. All other doctors told me to wait until the two weeks are over and the full effect is visible before scheduling a top-up. I paid GBP 300 for this and it's definitely not worth it. I also do not understand why they do not manage to have the doctors on overlapping schedules so that one is available. Cannot recommend this at all and I will go to a different clinic going further.

On the day of the procedure, the anaesthetist said it would not be safe to perform the procedure on the grounds of my medical history, even though they had 2 previous pre-assessments with my medical history written down weeks before the procedure.

Hi Im a 33 year old male who has been suffering with hair-loss for the last 5 years, I had finally plucked up the courage to go ahead with a hair transplant and contacted several companies in the UK and Europe regarding this procedure. I had several consultation with these companies many of whom where with members of staff that had no medical experience. All these companies where extremely eager to book me and take money from me!!! This in when alarm bells rang and I decided to research on surgeons and thankfully came across Dr Zioga.
Really happy I went ahead with a hair transplant. I searched a long time to see where was best and Harley street and Dr Zioga was the best choice I could of made.

review_title: Very professional pre and post care after hair transplant
review_body: Dr Zioga Lisa and the other members of the team were totally professional in all aspects to do with my hair transplant. Making sure I was healthy in all aspects even though the procedure is pain free and under local anaesthetic.

I cannot thank the team and Dr Zioga enough for giving me myself back and more! To get a second chance is incredible, to turn the clock back! The Wellness Clinic is quality from start to finish. But the skill is the teams care and Dr Zioga's incredible work. From the start I was carefully talked through the likely results and I fully trusted Dr Zioga whose passion, skill and art have delivered what they said in full. I had no temptation to save money ( and very probably get a bad result) elsewhere, I wanted the best for a lifetime result and I got it! The aftercare with Lisa was so helpful and calming, always positive about end results and Dr Zioga's follow ups were the icing on the cake, to relax knowing what she has achieved! I am over 50 and so pleased this us possible to be happy again, confident, relaxed and proud of the results. Trust this team

Dr Zioga and the team at Harley Street were absolutely brilliant. When I first went and met them, we had a very open discussion about what I was hoping to achieve from the procedure and what results I could expect. Around 12 months ago I was struggling for confidence and I was very unhappy with my wonky hairline which always made my hair look messy and unkempt. Now, 12 months on, I am ten times more confident and over the moon with the results. The hair looks completely natural and no one has ever questioned whether I had surgery. I do however get lots of compliments on my new style(s) which I'm now able to change regularly. I'm constantly being told by friends and family that I'm looking great compared to before. I would advise absolutely anyone who has the same reservations that I did that the treatment is worth it. It was incredibly expensive and I will be paying this off for a while, but during that time I am far happier, far more confident and ultimately that bit better looking!!

I wanted to share how pleased I am with my hair transplant experience with Dr. Zioga. I had my first FUE procedure in the USA about 2 years ago with a local doctor. This was a traditional FUE with shaven donor area and performed using ARTAS robot. Although the procedure itself went ok, the shaven back was very painful and uncomfortable for me for almost 2 months. I decided that I would not go thru another FUE procedure that requires shaven donor area. After doing some research online, I found out about Dr. Zioga and her innovative Unshaven FUE (UFUE) technique.
Dr Thomy Kouremada-Zioga and team were excellent. Everything was professionally done and I am truly amazed by the results.

review_title: Dr. Gupta has changed my life and I can't thank him enough!
review_body: Where do I start?�?.well here we go, I am a 40 something lady who has a chronic condition called Lipoedema to put in to simple terms my legs are extremely painful and really big and heavy due to the fat cells in both arms and legs swelling more than normal.

In my late twenties I had become self conscious of my receding hairline. I therefore decided to do something about it. I didn't want anyone to know I had had a procedure so I researched undetectable FUE and came across The Wellness Clinic and Dr Zioga, through the Daily Mail website.

review_title: FUE- Gold Standard Treatment and Excellent Result
review_body: I experienced classic male pattern receding hairline for maybe 10 years and it got the point where my widows peak had become a rapidly vanishing island.  I researched the latest hair transplant techniques at length and finally opted for The Wellness Clinic after a recommendation from a friend and former patient.

I am so pleased that I went to The Wellness Clinic to ask for help with my acne. To be quite honest, I felt like it was my last chance where I could get help. I had a very bad problem with my acne - they were very severe. When I went to my consultation, I was recommended to use skin products for 6 weeks before my first laser treatment, as my skin was in a very bad condition and it needed to be calmed down before the laser for maximum results. I was warned that I will get more acne when I first start using the products which was scaring me as I already had severe acne. When I first started using the products, I did get more acne but they weren't as bad as I thought. Finally, I had 3 n-lite treatments which I was so pleased with. However, in addition to n-lite and skin products, I've been taking erythromicin antibiotics for 6 months. It's been a long time but I am so happy that I didn't give up and carried on doing everything as I was told. Now, I still have a few spots and some scars but my face definitely doesn't look as bad as it used to and I am very pleased with the results. I've became a lot more confident and honestly I wasn't expecting to have such great results. I defiantly RECOMEND The Wellness Clinic of Harley Street and I don't know how much to thank them as they completely changed my life.
I find myself hugely surprised upon reading some of the poor reviews on this website and felt the need to share my own experience in defence of The Wellness Clinic.

I have been thinking about having lipo for about 12 years.  I?��ve always been worried about scaring or uneven results which is what kept me from going through with it.  I recently saw a friend who had microcanular lipo and showed me the results and told me how it was relatively easy and pain-free.
In August 2014 I went to Dr Zioga for a hair transplant and I couldn't be happier. The results are fantastic and the team are great.

review_title: What a difference a day makes
review_body: You may have been thinking about FUE for a long time before you actually decide to go ahead with it. Yes, think about it, but when you come to choose a practice that performs such a procedure, I recommend The Wellness Clinic Of Harley Street.

review_title: Had I known the result I would have done it sooner
review_body: I had no idea such a treatment existed until I saw Louis Walsh on TV - where did he get all that hair from ? Then I saw James Nesbitt - he used to be virtually bald and now has lots of hair. Where were they getting it from ?

So, where do I start! Losing hair since 30. First thinning up the sides. Do a great cover up but it bothers me. Then at 40 the middle thins and panic sets in. Can't hide it any more. It's time to go for the transplant but where do I go, will it work, do I want to spend a ridiculous amount of money in the hope it might bring back my diminishing confidence and make me resemble the boy/man I once was. Well I had my op a year ago today and I'm a changed man. But let's back track. I researched for two or three years prior. I tried a few places but Lisa from The Wellness Clinic was empathetic, had anecdotes to share and managed my expectations fantastically. Then I met Dr Zioga. I had lost a lot of hair. She suggested moving about 5000 from back to front, so I eventually agreed. I had to try something. Couldn't look in the mirror anymore. It's only my life saving's right? So I went for it. Did it hurt? Yes, now and then when the injections went in to numb the area. Did it traumatise me afterwards when I looked at 5000 holes in the back of my head, 5000 red dots at the front, bald sides and a few sprigs of hair on top. Yes! For two weeks, then things started to change. A month went by and I could start using products and get back to making it look almost presentable. And to cut this long story short, each month my hair improved, my hair style improved, my confidence improved. I feel 90% more confident in my appearance now. No more stressing when looking in the mirror. Believe me it's changed my life. Was it worth the money. Yes! I get the hair my wife gets the car. Fair deal! But let's be honest, it's not what it was when I was 20 and if you shine a light on it it can look thin, but the fact I don't walk around the place with a light on my head means it looks great! Dr Zioga really is the business. Her team are wonderful. If you've thought about having it done, get their advice and do it here. It's a life changer and if you're reading this, then it's obviously bothering you right?!
I had my first transplant procedure in February 2015. I was so pleased with the result that i had a further procedure in October 2016.
I had a hair procedure and from start to finish including the aftercare all went very smoothly. They are organised, efficient, personal, professional and highly skilled. Thank you!

I had a great experience at your Harley Street Clinic. I had a Hair removal consultation and had my first treatment a few days later. The therapist explained everything so clearly and I was quite nervous as not many clinics offer Laser hair removal for dark skin. So far I have seen great results cant wait to see end result after my course. :)

review_title: Pixel laser Dr Gupta and Private Clinic London
review_body: First of all I'll start by telling you I saved for 3 years just to go to this clinic and see this man as had seen him on TV and presumed I would receive best possible treatment here! After treatment I was given ridiculous after care advice and regretably followed it as he was the expert! I was advised to wash my face every 2 hours with what ever face wash I normally use for the next few days until all the dead skin had came off. When I asked don't I need to keep area moist etc as I had done research before treatment that seamed to imply this. I was told well you could put a little moisturiser on if you want to its up to you. So I said but which is best? he said the drier the better! so I said best not to then he said yes! At this point I also asked as the moisturiser I use has retinol in is that okay to use  he said yes that's fine! His own assistant had to correct him and then he said oh okay yes leave it about 3 days until you use that. I then developed dermatitis under my eye area from washing so much my skin was healing terribly I kept ringing to check I should really be washing my face this much and was told yes drier the better. On the next treatment when I explained about how long skin took to heal and dryness etc he said maybe just wash every 4-6 hours then. While I stood there with my freshly pixeled skin his assistant was already spraying air freshner in the air ready for there next patient. I Phoned concerned as Dr gupta had gone very close to my eye with laser and I now had broken veins under one eye! and skin appeared very thin dark and creppy. He spoke briefly with me and said that's fine don't worry I have a laser for that I can just zap that away book a follow appointment with me and we'll sort it. So I did! I turned up to be greeted as though he hadn't told me to book appointment etc he was like hello what are we doing for you  today. So when I said you told me to book appointment  with you to zap vein under eye.  He said unless you want to loose your eye sight I can't treat near your eye with those lasers.I had already spoken with him on the phone and he knew it was under eye area I was concerned with! So not only was I humiliated and spoke to rudely I had just traveled 124 miles to appointment as he had said yes book appointment I can zap that no problem. When I mentioned how concerned I was with under eye area now seaming so thin and dark. He said it will appear darker the pixel removes layers of skin!!! I went there for scar revision not to be given eye bags. I now feel so self conscious as my eye area is now all thin creepy and dark when I smile it sinks in to my eye area. I used to feel confident about my eyes even though my skin was horrid now i have no confidence at all. When I complained as to how upset I felt I was told someone would ring me and they never did then I was going to get a letter?. then I'd be hearing from the manager and eventually all I got was an email saying my eye area was never treated!! talk about salt in wounds! and they are sorry to hear of my dissatisfaction. I have since called many times and been told the manager is either on lunch or on the phone and she will ring me back! NO ONE HAS EVER RUNG BACK!! I have since had to derma roll under my eye area on numerous occasions in hope of regaining thickness to under eye area. The only reason I can think of them telling me to wash my face obsessively like that is to guard there own back from any possible infection but it would most certainly not give best healing results which is so important to achieve results you want from this sort of treatment. Sarah

review_title: Hair Removal at The Wellness Clinic
review_body: After years of shaving and using hair removal creams, I spoke to a friend who has had laser hair removal. I researched into the treatment and after much consideration (me being a massive wuss!) I decided to go for it.

It's a big step to make in deciding to have a hair transplant. Will it be painful and what will the results be like?, these are just 2 questions from a long list that could make you walk away before you even get in the door.

review_title: 5 star experience with Dr Zioga and her dedicated team
review_body: I recently had a U-FUE hair transplant at The Wellness Clinic. What a fantastic experience!!!
I recently had Botox at the The Wellness Clinic, Harley Street - the clinic was recommended to me by a friend and so I went along having not read any opinions on the clinic.

well what can i say, i visited the harley street clinic last year to discuss the above. obviously i was very nervous and didn't know quite what to expect. But on meeting Dr Zioga and her team they immediately put me at great ease and comfort, and what a wonderful person and team they are. On the day off the procedure it couldn't of gone any better, i was their around 7 hrs but it felt more like 3. All the time Dr Zioga reassured me through out and i have to say the end product was truly amazing.
A superb experience. The team headed by the consummately professional Dr Ziorga and her two lovely assistants put me at my ease and at no time did I worry throughout the day.

I had Vaser Liposuction to my flanks in Autumn 2014 after hearing great things about Dr Dennis Wolf. I was not disappointed. Not only is he a leading figure in this  field and showing the professionalism and expertise I would want, but he is also such a lovely gentleman, he immediately put me at ease and kept me calm (as I was nervous). His team around him at the surgery were also fantastic with their care and support. A few months on and my flanks look incredible, I am so happy I chose this procedure and Dr Wolf as he is superb at his work, a total artist! I would highly recommend The Wellness Clinic and Dr Dennis Wolf. I am a very happy patient!
It's been 7 weeks post my stomach lipo and I am absolutely thrilled with my results. I did some research and found Dr Gupta and felt most comfortable with him.

review_title: Operating Clinic is a Converted Bedsit!
review_body: The Private. Clinic was the last consultation I had from those I choose to visit and thinking on Harley Street, renown for cosmetic excellence, I expected a professional clean, tidy experience. Their office was dusty, the paint peeling off the walls, the toilets was down a corridor which had barely enough room to sit and do your business, dirty windows and well pretty grimy and this was just the start of it.

review_title: Better results from a fat transfer than I ever imagined thanks to Dr Dennis Wolf and the great staff at The Wellness Clinic
review_body: I decided to go ahead with a fat transfer from my hips and thighs to my buttocks and am so happy I chose Dr Wolf and The Wellness Clinic over any other Doctors I saw.
I had N-lite acne treatment with The Wellness Clinic in Harley Street as I've always had bad skin.

review_title: The result themselves look and feel natural; the process has been simple, pain free and best of all no scars. I highly recommend The Wellness Clinic from my experience Dr Zioga and her team are fantast
review_body: I spent endless time researching information around hair restoration; it was proving difficult in deciding which surgeon to work with. It?��s a scary thought to let someone perform a medical procedure on your face never mind where the technique involved is so specialized. For this reason I had to ensure I find someone capable of meeting my expectation whilst achieving a natural look. I am glad I took time to research well and found Dr Zioga whom is more than capable to perform this procedure to an exceptionally high standard.

I had a consultation with Dr Gupta earlier this year about having vaser liposuction in my calf and ankle area. He was very open and honest with me about the procedure, the risks and results and all. He also explained to me that microcannular liposuction would be the best option as vaser would only take fat from one area. Completely different consultation experience compared to one I had had a week prior. I was not made to feel like the clinic just wanted my money, or was rushing me or was forcing me to do anything, in fact it was the complete opposite and Dr Gupta advised me to think about it. I had already made up my mind about having surgery before I walked in for my consultation it was just a case of where and who could give me the best service. I made my decision that I would chose The Wellness Clinic and Dr Gupta and contacted Kasia to go ahead with it. (Kasia was very helpful throughout and answered any questions I had, was so friendly and welcoming when I went to the clinic.) I had the procedure done at Brompton Road. The staff were calm and welcoming and again answered any questions I had. When I went in for my procedure there was two nurses as well as Dr Gupta. I felt a bit uncomfortable about it at first but one of the nurses was very talkative and for the most part of the surgery I didn't realise I was having surgery done because she took my mind off of it! The procedure seemed to go pretty quick and easy for me and before I knew it I was finished. The day after my surgery I had a missed call and a voice mail left from the clinic making sure I was okay and if I had any problems to call in. Around 6 weeks later I had a follow up appointment with Dr Gupta and he told me I can come back any time as he would like to see the progress. Overall I am so happy with my results and the service and care I got from everyone at The Wellness Clinic, best decision I ever made!

review_title: Professional and efficient, The Wellness Clinic has restored my confidence!
review_body: At 25 years old I had quite prominent frown lines on my forehead, I was forever conscious of how unhappy I looked in photos and day to day life. After a consultation with Selena at the Manchester practice I went on to have two sessions of botox with Liz who is a nurse there. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful despite a few hiccups in the scheduling of my appointments due to illness, I was constantly updated and informed of any changes. Everyone involved in the process was so friendly and reassuring, describing exactly what would happen and managing my expectations. The results are fantastic and it is by far the best decision I've made. I would recommend The Wellness Clinic to anybody, in particular the St Johns Street practice in Manchester. Carly, 25

review_title: Vaser Lipo with Dr Dennis Wolf was the best thing I've ever done!

Dr. Wolf is super professional and made me feel at ease. The procedure was only a few hours, and I walked in and out. I was back at Yoga the following week, and my kids didn't even realize anything was wrong or different. The worst part was the compression garnet, but that is just because we hit a hot spell in London for a few days, it is actually really easy to hide under clothing.

review_title: The BEST decision I made was choosing The Wellness Clinic and Dr Dennis Wolf. I am so happy with my whole experience, the staff are so nice and my results  are great.
review_body: I was very anxious about having Vaser on my stomach flanks and back area and had several consultations with various surgeons but after my consultation with Dr Dennis Wolf at The Wellness Clinic I knew they would be the best choice. My experience was great from the very beginning, the staff were all so nice, accommodating and helpful and provided me with all the information I needed and were always available to answer any questions I had. Dr Wolf did an amazing job and I was so so happy when I saw my stomach for the first time the day after my procedure and couldn't believe the difference already. I was even more delighted with the aftercare and attention and the fact that I could actually contact my surgeon directly if I had an emergency. This was so comforting and I felt so well looked after and knew I was in safe hands. My results are fantastic and so natural I have recommended The Wellness Clinic and Dr Wolf to all my friends and family and will continue to do so. Dr Wolf and The Wellness Clinic provide an honest, realistic and personal service which can't be beaten in my opinion. For me they are the best. I can't thank them enough for what they have done for me and making my experience so nice. x

review_title: Wish I'd found Sk:n 10 years ago!
review_body: I wouldn't hesitate for a minute to recommend Sk:n! I have an unusual case of acne scarring and for a decade was told the results may be mixed due to the abnormal scarring and location. It was also questionable how much time off work I would need and the cost was usually just an estimate. All the doubts left me living with something that has destroyed my self confidence and relationships. I almost accepted that it was never going to change until I saw the Lasercare branch of Sk:n at James Cook hospital. Sk:n being based within an NHS hospital immediately reassured me they would give the correct information so I made an appointment to see the dermatologist: I wasn't dissapointed!                                                                     After a few minutes consultation the Doctor asked me what my hopes were and confirmed that I had a realistic outcome. He confidently offered a treatment plan and said because I was travelling long distance he could start the treatment that day if I wanted. The reality then hit me that not only was this happening... but the pain I'd been previously been told about was also now reality! The procedure took about 5 to 10 minutes and hurt no more than someone lightly flickering their finger on your skin, even when on very sensitive/delicate skin. I was able to wear clothes immediately after and complete normal activity though my skin felt a bit 'sun burnt' for a few hours and I was very colourful for 2 weeks while the bruising healed but over all I am highly impressed! It certainly wasn't the 'no pain, no gain' I was expecting even with Sk:n's reassurance. The only thing I cant sing the praises of is the result... purely because I have at least 2 more treatments to go! What I can say is one treatment down I believe the scarring has faded up to 50% which is amazing! I hope to report it is barely visible/gone by the end of Summer!
Very friendly, professional and efficient.

review_title: Treatments great - Customer Service could be better
review_body: Update: Moved it to a 4 as the office manager, Michaela was genuinely apologetic, listened to me and resolved everything.  My son is having the final treatment with Leslie, who did the other two. Happy customer. Original review: I booked 3 treatments and various recommended products for my 17 year old son spending about �380. Treatments about �100 a time. The lady who did the initial consultation and first two treatments was absolutely lovely, she put him at ease (he even went by himself the second time). We had to leave 10 days minimum in between treatments. He was going on holiday Jan 28th and we needed to change the date of his second treatment. I phoned their contact centre, again a polite guy who tried his best to find ways of fitting us in before 28th January for final 2 treatments. It wasn?��t possible. He advised we keep Jan 20th (our original 3rd appointment) as is and rebook for the 3rd treatment on his return. Second treatment went great, his skin was looking clearer than ever. A really happy teen. Luke came back from hols, I phoned up and booked him in for 3rd and final treatment for the 14th Feb. And then it went horribly wrong. It was a different person who met us, not a problem for us, but then she said, so you?��re booked in for a review. No a treatment I corrected. Surprised she went back to reception to check. Came back into the room and said: ?��No, it?��s a review. You missed your appointment on the 26th January.?ѝ I told her we?��d never made an appointment for the 26th. In an aggressive tone which my son commented on immediately after we left she responded with ?��You were told that if you missed an appointment again you forfeit the treatment.?ѝ But I?��ve never missed an appointment before? I told her that my son couldn?��t possibly have had a treatment booked in for that day as their was a minimum number of days between treatments. Her response: ?��well those days are flexible?ѝ. There was no manager available and no one to escalate it to. I just couldn?��t believe her outright refusal to believe a word I was saying. Now my son said he?��d never go back, even though it was working and the first woman who did the treatments was absolutely lovely. I?��m gutted. His confidence in his appearance was really lifting. So no I cannot recommend a clinic whose default mode is to assume I?��m a liar and get aggressive with me.
Really friendly and helpful. Made me feel so much more confident in myself with the results!

review_title: Disappointed with the consistency of care and results.
review_body: I had had a full course of laser treatment with a small company 3 years ago with no regrowth. I went to skn for top up sessions and was only offered a course of treatment (6 sessions). It really does depend who you get. There?��s no consistency and they certainly never took into consideration I had had a full course previously. They wanted me to come in every 4 weeks (but wouldn?��t do areas that had no regrowth in case of stimulating growth...Why come in every 4 weeks then if not to sell more sessions later down the track) and the setting levels they were using over those sessions slowly built up to a medium setting but the last two were back down to the first session I had. They?��ve offered me a review now that I?��ve finished which will probably sell me another course as the level of hair reduction is minimal. No comparison to the first course I had with a different company which was consistent and tailored to what I needed rather than a standard response from whoever I happened to get that week. Apparently I found out in my last appointment that I hadn?��t had a skin test after each session so couldn?��t get a higher setting...no one mentioned skin tests after each session once! I think they are more about making money than actually giving people lasting results. There was no reason that I should have been on the minimum by the time I finished except that no one coordinated my treatment or took anytime to actually think about what was needed. I?��m sure I will be offered another course of 6 if I do go for the review so will be looking elsewhere to see if I can get better results. Really disappointed and what feels like a waste of money 12 months on. I would say all the girls were perfectly pleasant and the first three sessions were done by the same person who was very good and did increase the setting but I saw a different person each time after that.

I was extremely disappointed with my consultation, it was a complete waste of time and money. I was told I needed to pay �25 as I would need to see an acne professional. This couldn?��t have been further from the truth. I don?��t believe the girl I saw had any qualifications or expert knowledge in acne whatsoever. We spent 10 minutes talking about my skin, very general questions about skin regime etc. She didn?��t even look at my skin, we were sat a metre apart. She then advised it would be best to see my GP and that she had no further advice on my skin care as all seemed fine. At this point I was shocked the appointment was over. I said I?��d like to know more about my skin type, the type of acne I have etc. She attempted to get out a machine to look at my skin which was in fact broken and she said they never use it. I then had to ask her to suggest some daily products and she couldn?��t even remember the names of the products she was suggesting. I left the appointment feeling worse than I went in. Absolute disgrace of a service. If the only advice is going to be go see a doctor for some antibiotics why isn?��t that suggested in the initial call...ah yes because you want �25 for doing absolutely nothing.

review_title: So glad I ignored negative reviews!
review_body: I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews but decided to make up my own mind and so glad I did. I went for an acne consultation with Chloe in the Bristol Salon and she couldn?��t have been more helpful. Very knowledgeable and explained everything clearly and gave me all my options to consider and prices and was not at all pushy. The products I have bought were explained including the cost and I am now feeling really positive about my review in 6 weeks and further treatments. She was very understanding about my existing medical condition and listened to my concerns about affecting this. A positive experience with a therapist who is a credit to the company.
Absolutely rubbish , 5 sessions and still same
Always feel so at ease when in the Skin Clinic. Nurses are great at what they do and also lovely.

review_title: SKIN clinic was recommended to me by?�?
review_body: SKIN clinic was recommended to me by friend who did laser hair removal in Guildford and results were excellent. Unfortunately my experience wasn?��t so good with this clinic in Reading. I did full body laser hair removal, wrong setting were chosen on 1 area therefore results are very bad. After the first session the lady who did it has done test patch so that when I come next time higher settings are done on my legs, when I came in next time there was different lady and setting were not changed (so another waste if treatment). Every time I was coming in to have a treatment done I was mentioning that there is no result on my legs and I was told that result will be reviewed after the last treatment however it wasn?��t and I was just sent home after the last session. I am very sad and disappointed. Waste of money and time. I would not recommend this clinic in Reading.

Went for laser hair removal, and after 3 sessions the growth went worse and the last time they increased the waves intensity ended up burning my skin which I cannot get rid of the marks on my skin and it?��s been 10 months, was cancelled twice upon arrival. Wanted a refund for the remaining sessions I paid for and the ones I had, it?��s been a year chasing them and even the regional manager email and no reply, all complaints go down a drain, I paid �1250 which I financed and now want my money back but no luck!

review_title: The team are friendly and welcoming
review_body: The team are friendly and welcoming, and put clients at ease, making for an altogether pleasant experience at each visit.

review_title: I've only been using this lotion for a?�?

review_title: I honestly can?��t recommend the Sk:n Middlesbrough Clinic enough!

review_title: Very polite and nothing too much?�?

Kaz is amazing. I've suffered from acne for many many years. I have Dr Hussein and he's a miracle worker. My skin is recovering so well and is now 95% clear. I've also had CO2 laser done with Dr Hussein which has significantly improved my scars. I cannot recommend them enough.

review_title: If you value fellow humans go elsewhere.
review_body: I must say the service has always been great however If you value fellow humans and practitioners go elsewhere. After speaking with staff I was informed of long working hours each day with relatively short 40 minute break only and usually fully booked till their shifts finish. Meaning they may overrun and have to do overtime sometimes unpaid. For a relatively physical job this is not appropriate.

review_title: What you promised  in the consultation vs what was delivered
review_body: What you promised  in the consultation vs what was delivered:

Awful service they refused to remove a mole when I believed it was the clients choice. So no go to the Chelmsford branch. And it cost �150. Even though they said they can?��t do it due to me being left with a scar!

I paid for 8 sessions of full laser hair removal and twice my appointment has been cancelled. Once because the staff didnt put my appointment on their system and the second time the laser machine didnt work. Not professional and for the price they charge they shoukd have excellent customer service and make sure their equipment is working before getting the clients at the clinic.

I had used the Sk:n cleanser and exfoliating cleanser in the past and they both were great. However they have change the gel to be a more creamy texture. It feels that it is not cleaning at all and also leaves my skin very oily. I have only used both products for three days and my skin is oily and full of acne. Very disappointed.

review_title: SKIN is brilliant for spot treatments.
review_body: SKIN is brilliant for spot treatments. I'm always very happy with the results. My flare ups are always gone within a few days and kept under control when I'm using SKIN.

review_title: Rude Manager and no complaint tel number
review_body: I paid almost �1000 for a course of 8 tattoo removal sessions. When booking my 5th session the clinc cancelled on me twice in March due to lack of staff. When I went into the bluewater branch I was greeted by an extremely rude manager who said that my courses expired in December, I explained that was impossible as I was booked in for March and that I had not recieved any correspondence to say that my course will or has expired. I have all the evidence to support my claim and have tried to take it further. I have sent multiple emails and called head office 6 times over the last month. They refuse to give me the complaints departments phone number or the email addrees of the person they say is handling the case and therefore I highly advise for you not to use this service.

We have had a really bad experience with the greenhithe branch. My partner originally booked and paid for eight tattoo removal sessions and received four. However, the final four sessions have been rejected although having previous correspondence confirming final sessions and without any notification. When we went into branch the manager advised the sessions have expired when we had confirmation via text and email to say that the sessions would go ahead. My partner has recorded that he has called Sk:n head office six times but had yet had a response on his complaint. We also received a formal letter on the 31st October advising that a formal response would be sent within a month but we are yet to hear anything. We have no choice but to advise people not to use the company as we would hate for anyone to have the same experience and their money stolen. A very unhappy customer.

review_title: From the very start I was well looked?�?
review_body: From the very start I was well looked after and felt at ease. Given in depth information about the treatment that I received.

review_title: After being burned by one of the?�?
review_body: After being burned by one of the practitioners in the leeds clinic on my second treatment, I have been scarred for life on my shin, and even though I have been reimbursed for this awful experience, Sk:n makes it impossible to follow through on anything, as they promise to phone back but never do. I have to repeat the same story over and over as it is never logged properly into the system. Going through the customer service is very slow, repetitive and unhelpful. It took me so long to receive compensation for this mistake, and now I have been promised free treatments but this hasn't been followed through either. I wish I had done my treatments elsewhere.
Fast and efficient service

review_title: I went to the Sk:n Clinic for a course?�? Laser Hair Removal
review_body: I went to the Sk:n Clinic for a course of laser hair removal, which was a course of 6 sessions.  The 1st 3 sessions were fine as I had a very competent person complete the treatment.  On the 4 session they changed the person and the session resulted in patchy removal with hair still left on my face.  Fast forward to my last session last week and I was given yet another person to conduct my treatment.  I explained that the hair was growing back faster and I wasn't seeing any positive results. She suggested we conduct the session and come in for a review once completed. The normal pre-clean and shave was extremely quick and she the progressed to use the laser. From the first zap it felt way different from previous sessions, which I explained (it felt like my face was burning). Her response was to increase the air blowing and continue. I stated a number of times it didn't feel the same but she continued. At the end of the session my face felt like someone had put a live flame on my neck. I went home and discovered my neck was red raw. Next morning I woke up with a fully burnt neck. Terrible, I have not been able to go to work, my self confidence is at a low.

review_title: Don't bother to go there - very disappointing experiences
review_body: I've purchased a dermapen package in Shepherds Bush. Roma, the practitioner is really lovely and seriously professional, however the admin staff and clinic are appalling. Roma seems to be the only person working at the clinic and she is super stretched. She hardly has free time so it's almost impossible to book appointments. Had an appointment last week but never got the reminder so rang the centre and they gave me the wrong time so missed my slot and Roma didn't have enough time to do the treatment.

review_title: Premium price for basic services and basic customer care
review_body: I purchased a laser hair removal package of 8 sessions with Sk:n. Started the treatment and was really happy with the first results (even purchased a further package for another area). However, halfway through the treatment, I noticed there was no hair reduction in certain areas and pointed this out to the member of staff doing the procedure. Instead of enquiring into it, her reaction was rather defensive and I felt ridiculed to say at least. Pointed this out before each remaining session and nothing really happened. Except a free session because their laser stopped working. Fast forward, at the end of the treatment I still had a patch of hair in my nether areas, and another area which has not really responded to the treatment. At the end of treatment review (which they rescheduled with little notice), they rushed straight into discussing further treatments without even looking at the results. However, after I said I wasn?��t happy with the results, this concluded with an additional ?��free of charge?ѝ review with their dermatologist, who said that my hair did not respond to the treatment, and that further treatment wouldn?��t address the problem (I pointed this out halfway through the treatment, why did I have to pay and continue with it if it wasn?��t working???). They never actually checked how the hair responded during the treatment, as I had to shave before. No in between actual result reviews (they did ask me before each session what percentage of reduction I think I achieved). After the last apppointment with the doctor I was promised a call from the manager, which never happened. I know I am supposed to go in to maintain the (poor) results, but no one advised me of this, or the frequency of these sessions. So I basically paid the premium price for going to a ?��clinic?ѝ presumably staffed with medically trained people who know what they?��re doing - instead of a beauty place where I could have done it for a quarter of the price) - and can?��t help but wonder where is the premium in it? At the end of it, I feel like I was just a number for them, they cashed in, why bother? I am disgusted with the results and the service I received.

review_title: I am a current customer of Sk:n Harley?�?
review_body: I am a current customer of Sk:n Harley Street Clinic and I have had various laser hair removal treatments since December 2017. The staff here are friendly and warm, especially Ingrid who works at the reception desk and Mirela the nurse practitioner who takes care of my laser hair treatment. I remember when I had my initial assessment and Mirela gave in-depth information about the treatment and different options that were available to me. She also made me feel comfortable to ask any questions that I had and she put my mind at rest with her reassuring answers.

The Skin Clinic is professional and offers good services. Having had laser hair for Brazilian and full leg, I am extremely happy with the outcome after 6 sessions on each area. It is better than I can have hoped and I still have 2 more appointments for each should I choose to use them. The clinic in Glasgow is clean and all staff are welcoming, polite and knowledgeable. If unwanted hair is something that bothers you, this is definitely the place to come.
Rang call center twice today... 7 minutes no answer first time. 8 minutes no answer second time... poor and puts me off using. The hold messaging is just hard sell

review_title: Wonderful 5* Staff but Unfortunate Acne Treatment Results
review_body: Though I can't fault the staff at the clinic for being polite and friendly and courteous, unfortunately I had a terrible response to their salycylic acid peels. After a course of three peels and after following their product recommendations and routines to the letter, my acne has got even worse rather than better - whereas I used to have a few large spots that could be covered fairly easily by a blob of foundation, I now have a sea of whiteheads and clusters of very painful, very angry cystic acne - every day I wake up and there's more than three new ones. It's caused me a lot of distress and embarrassment and knocked my confidence, I feel like a nervous teenager again and I'm reluctant to leave the house! Again staff have been very helpful and nothing but kind and supportive about this, refering me to one of their specialist dermatologists in London (although I'm going to have to wait 2 weeks to see them, fingers crossed this gets the problem sorted). So while I can't fault the wonderful staff for being kind, welcoming and professional, unfortunately I am less than impressed with the results of the treatment so far.

review_title: I ordered Lycogel in Honey from Skin?�?
review_body: I ordered Lycogel in Honey from Skin website as it was out of stock in London stores. I was sent Pearl instead of Honey. I contacted Skin customer services on 30/12/18 and was told there was no one in that day that could deal with my enquiry and that I would be contacted the following day by telephone. I wasn?��t contacted and now am left with an unsuitable product that I cannot use as doesn?��t match my skin tone and have been left out of pocket with no refund. I would never order online from skin again and next time I will order directly from the Lycogel website. I feel let down as I have been a loyal customer for years.

Cardiff Sk:n clinic - Very disappointing service. I was pressured into booking an appointment with a nurse, despite having asked to see a doctor. My appointment with the nurse involved them trying to sell me seemingly harsh and expensive treatments for my skin, having not taken into account my skin type, concerns etc. I then requested an appointment with a doctor and booked one at the cost of �150. 30 minutes after my appointment was due to start the receptionist came to tell me that the doctor was running late and that the appointment was �250!! I obviously declined this. I was given a bottle of moisturiser as an apology. Really unacceptable service and will not be returning. It was clear that the money is the only drive and my concerns were not taken into account
The Guildford clinic staff are friendly and helpful.

review_title: Awful experience - be wary of upfront payment, for anything!
review_body: Awful experience, shocking customer service, multiple last minute cancellations enforced by the clinic and no refund!

Very bad delivery service, i am really disappointed. I made the order on 30 Nov and received it after ten days, and when I contacted them they claimed that the delivery man tried to deliver the parcel and left a card for me (which I didn?��t find) and then they gave us the postcode for the post office where they left the parcel and it was far from my house although there is one down the street near my house.

review_title: Onto my 4th men's laser hair removal?�?
review_body: Onto my 4th men's laser hair removal treatment with Milton Keynes clinic.  So far I've been astonished by the results - far exceeded what I expected.  Have seen two different technicians and both have been friendly, reassuring, professional and courteous.  Having this treatment has allowed me to regain confidence in myself and my body.  My partner has treatment with another provider and although cheaper, it has been far less effective.  I would highly recommend the MK clinic for men's laser hair removal.

review_title: Really happy with service and results
review_body: Really happy with service and results. Will definitely consider further treatments.

review_title: I visited the Canary Wharf clinic twice?�?
review_body: I visited the Canary Wharf clinic twice for lip fillers and had previously (and in between) done fillers back home as well. The first time the experience was super painless and I was happy with the result, albeit Juvederm is not very good in my opinion, having tried Restylane and one more brand which both had better volume and longevity. So on this note, it would be good to provide more brand options. All the times I have done fillers, my only problem area has been the top lip. I always specify this, and the ideal outcome is to achieve a balance since my bottom lip is already very adequate. Sure, sometimes a pinch or two can be added in the middle to make it rounder, but nothing that would extend its size or go towards the bottom lips line! And so, at my second visit with the same doctor, although I have specified this as usual, he/she added some to the bottom, even around the line, and actually, on one side it is outside the actual lip itself and this is noticeable when i touch it or smile. This is extremely dissapointing not only because I specifically said i want all of it at the top, it is also a waste of the syringe which could be going to the top!!!  Completely threw off the balance I was after making the problem the same, just with overall bigger lips and also feeling ridiculously awkward and uncomfortable about my bottom lip...The Dr insisted that it ''would not look good'' if i added more to the top, but frankly i have injected more in the past where it was more affordable and those where the only times i got the desired results (and better products). There is also a habit of leaving a few ml in the syringe both times, again with the claim that there is no need to add more or there is no where else to put it etc, but when i am paying for a full syringe, i expect to use all of it... AND in the spots that i am actually seeking to add to! I will note that, the Dr did offer to dissolve the material in the bottom lip, but i was way more bruised the second time i went and had a very small window to go and dissolve it before moving abroad and already looked so beaten up. In addition, this would not really solve the wasted ml that have gone to the bottom lip. Surely the Dr is skilled, but an aesthetic opinion is something that only a client should appoint especially when it is discussed and verbalised both before and during. I wasn't after looking like a Kardashian by any means and also knowing the quality of Juvederm as opposed to the other brands I used, i knew exactly what i was after. But even if someone was looking to do something ''extreme'', as long as it is safe, i see no reason why a Dr should oppose that or decide where to inject while the patient is laying there with trust, not really able to speak up when a needle is cm away from your face... on a last note, the website could be way more clear/detailed and accurate about pricing and the service over the phone is equally clueless about advice/costs, only able to book/cancel appointments really.

review_title: I went to the Holborn branch
review_body: I went to the Holborn branch, I asked to be booked in for an appointment but when I got there they only had me down for a consultation which is not what I had asked for. They luckily managed to book me in and move things around so I could be seen to. Then once I had the procedure I had an express Hydrafacial (30mins) literally the worst I've had - the lady literally rubbed some glycholic acid on my skin and just gave it the once over. I came out and there was no difference to my skin whatsoever. Don't waste your money coming here.. just pay the extra for better quality results!

review_title: My skin has never looked better and I?�?
review_body: My skin has never looked better and I am honestly so happy when I look in the mirror- I feel myself again.

At first it was a daunting procedure, with one of the nurses sessions being a not so pleasant experience. After seeing Zaharina a couple of times I felt in good hands. I saw Zaharina majority of my time at the clinic after this, she always had a welcoming attitude, knowledgable and at all times had my best interest at the forefront! Overall my results have been great and I?��m very pleased to have gone through Skin.

I have had severe issues with my skin ever since adolences and nothing really solved it, till i started using SK:N products. They are god sent. It has created miracles on my skin. My acnes, scaring, poor pigmentation, combination skin is now all clear and everyone asks me what i have done. I use only SK:N products on my face and swear by it.

review_title: I am a returning customer to Sk:N as?�?
review_body: I am a returning customer to Sk:N as I've had laser done several years ago at a different clinic on a different part of my body. After having an initial Sk:N consultation a month ago at Harley Street, I booked my first appointment. As I work full time I could only do evening appointments and so the next available appointment was a month away(!) which was surprising but I accepted that people book their appointments weeks in advance. At 13:30 today I received a phone call asking me to reschedule my appointment which was due at 18:00 today. After 15 minutes of speaking to the national number (you're unable to speak to the clinic directly) and the lady screening through the different London clinics diaries, they have now rebooked me for 2 weeks time. Therefore my first laser appointment will have been 6 weeks after my initial consultation. This really is an unacceptable period of time to wait. As an NHS employee I would expect this from an NHS clinic but never from a private clinic. To make matters worse when looking up how to complain you can only post a letter or call them up and no doubt spend further hours on the phone trying to get anywhere. There is no option to email them. Not impressed with the level of professionalism or customer service which is disappointing as I've had very positive experiences in the past at Sk:N at Chelmsford.

My experience at SK:N Birmingham has been fantastic, my treatment has had excellent results and boosted my confidence. The team at the clinic are so friendly and make you feel so welcome. I wouldn't hesitate to go back if I ever required any other treatments.
I?��ve been using Sk:n products for over 5 years now and my skin is awesome. Love the exfoliation cream... my family uses it too.
Excellent service and professional and friendly practitioners. My skin looks so much better now!
Their products are very good, highly recommended. However, their treatments are not effective, especially acne treatment and it s quite pricey as well.

very happy with the service i receive from here.

review_title: To be avoided at all costs!
review_body: I placed an order on their website for some products. They do not tell you anywhere the estimates delivery date. I have never received a dispatched email nor a tracking number. After 3 days I sent an email to their customer service: no reply. After two more days, another email: again no reply. After a third email and a third no reply (and no parcel delivered) I phoned their warehouse. An uninterested lady answered, she asked my order number and told me the items were scheduled to be delivered the next day (oh the case!) I tried to explain her the lack of post sales service and assistance but she abruplty replied me she was not her fault ad that the products were on their way. The items NEVER arrived despite phoning them every day thereafter. Every day a different excuse: wrong address (not true), issue with the van, items at the post office, and so on. Needless to say that today, after 16 days from my order, the items haven?��t arrived. No one seemed to be concerned by my complaints and no one email nor call me back. I have asked my credit card to initiate a chargeback. They are a fraud!

All the staff at sk:n Nottingham (Loughborough Road) were always friendly throughout my treatment. They made me feel comfortable right from the start and were always happy to help in any way they could (answering questions, booking in appointments at the best time for me). Throughout the year that I was having my treatment, they always provided great customer service.

My therapist was very professional, she explained the procedures in details before the treatment, I knew exactly what I would expect. She also asked how I felt throughout the treatment to make sure I felt alright.

review_title: Several issues (not all listed) but the situation has now been resolved by the manager.
review_body: Birmingham Harborne Road clinic: I don't usually write bad reviews but I felt the need to as I am being completely ignored by sk:n clinics. I had started a laser hair removal treatment with a finance plan with omni capital to help me spread out the cost. During my first free consultation, which was to know more about it and to ask any questions and for me to decide if I was going to have the treatment or not, I asked all I needed to ask, and was reassured by the person I saw who told me that if there was any problem or if I ever needed to stop for any reason, it was absolutely fine and that I would get a refund. I made the first payment to pay before you start the treatment (I was urged to do it as quickly as possible so we could start the treatment as quickly as possible). I paid on the same day and then applied for the finance plan. Omni capital accepted the finance plan and I had my very first session of laser hair removal 2 weeks later. After my first session, which I didn't fully completed because it was extremely painful and I ended up shaking like a leaf for over 40mins after the first 10mins of treatments, I had to tell the person to stop because I couldn't do any more. She was nice, friendly and understanding so I have nothing bad to say about her. She told me it was fine, to see how I'd fell and that I could just do what was left to be done next time.

I have been a customer of the Birmingham Bull Street clinic for a number of years now. There?��s nobody else I?��d trust to administer my Botox. Staff are professional and so friendly. My final appointment is in January and I am already very pleased with the results. I used to get waxed in all those areas every month, spending over �65 a month. This has just made my life so much easier. I would definitely recommend. The staff are very understanding. I have found laser painful at times, but the staff accommodate to that. And can go faster/slower depending on your pain threshold. They are very patient.

I've been going to Sk:n Southampton (East street) for over 2 years now for laser hair removal on face and arms and have found the staff to be polite, friendly and professional, on time and skilled at their job. The premises and treatment area is clear and well-lit and has proper air conditioning and such, with a hefty-looking good quality laser and cooling machine(s). As a trans woman, I've been treated with dignity and respect with regards to my gender and presentation, and the staff seem well versed in such issues. The rate of laser hair removal for me personally (dark hair on fairly light skin, so an ideal case) has been fair, slower than I'd hoped to get the results that I wanted on my face (about 21 sessions from start to just needing top-ups), but it's all well worth it in my opinion, Price is fair when they have a deal on (there's almost always between 30 and 60% off the RRP prices) and while it's certainly not "cheap", the results are well worth the price IMHO. I have not utilised their other services and treatments so I cannot comment on those. Overall I'm very happy with the service I've received from Sk:n and have recommended it to others in my situation!

review_title: Long, tiresome, fruitless, expensive journey so far. And I have not even started treatment!
review_body: I am not happy with the way I have been treated at all. I have already mentioned to the clinic manager that I am displeased with the way I have been handled, and the apology I received has proven to be empty words. Another shoddy ?��appointment?�� yesterday. I left work early and caught a taxi to ensure I made the appointment as the bus did not show to get me to the clinic on time. I arrived to be told the doctor who was meant to be present for my review wasn?��t there (again). I?��ve been rescheduled now for mid December to see if the replacement laser for the KTP will be suitable. If not they think they?��re sending me to Nottingham for treatment. What I would like to know is, if this treatment is unsuitable how do I go about getting the �200 sk:n have had from me refunded? The �150 I paid for a consultation with a doctor (who I was told is unreliable and turns up when he wants) that I was 40 minutes late being seen for, not given any pricing information or much information at all really, lasted all of 5 minutes and was recommended treatment with a laser that that branch have stopped using, and for the �50 I paid over the phone that is being held to pay for my patch test? This has been going on since June. I?��ve turned up for appointments to be sent home, had appointments rearranged then cancelled at the last minute, had an apology treatment that lasted all of 10 minutes and was face wash strength (another practitioner I use words) and have turned up to see doctors that aren?��t there. This has cost me in my time, work time and money and travel money. I have tried to be so understanding because I?��m desperate for the treatment and the clinic manager has been nice to me. However this has caused me a great deal of distress and honestly if this laser is unsuitable, I have been sold a consultation for a service that clinic doesn?��t provide.
NHS service at private prices. AVOID.

Its a scam! They ask you to pay a deposit of �25 to schedule a consultation for a facial that no other clinic asks for. I called days ahead to cancel my appointment and they asked for my card details to make the refund, they assured me it had been processed. Sure as heck, I have been charged! Called again to get it refunded, was assured that someone would call me back to sort, never happened! Bunch of thieving cowboys.

review_title: The member of staff that took my call?�?Clare
review_body: The member of staff that took my call was friendly, and very professional before contacting SK:N I had called other companies who were not knowledgeable about their products I shall now purchase my beauty products from SK:N

Probably my worst experience with a beauty clinic. Having had a great consultation with one of the advisers at the Reading clinic, I had gone to look at getting hydrafacials as a friend had raved on about it, I was advised to also consider the Jessner peel as an option as I have acne prone skin and told that my appointment would mean I could have either the hydrafacial  pro or jessner once I decided for the day. Then my appointment was changed twice and when I finally arrived, I was told there was no one to do the pro on me just the basic hydrafacial. I made a fuss considering I had been informed the reason  my appointment was changed the second time was because the specific adviser appointed to me was off sick. After a lot of toing and froing, I finally had someone to do the facial that was apparently qualified. So then the facial started, lo and behold, the laser machine refused to work, 20 minutes of tampering later, still not working sowe proceed with the hydrafacial basic which doesn't have much impact on the acne prone skin. Although I was given a discount, I was surprised that I was asked to pay at all. I received an email asking about my experience which I replied to, however I was never contacted considering I left the same review. Never again SKN, never again.

I went to your service once for a consultation and microdermabrasion however, I found the service you are offering is very expensive compared to your competitors which I decided to move to. When I did move the service was much more thorough where they spent around 45 minutes per sessions on my face compared to 15 minutes/
Friendly, professional, and extremely helpful! Would certainly recommend to anyone looking for laser treatments - I had a great experience.
I�?have almost finished my treatment with SK:N clinic in Chester and I could not be happier with my tattoo removal results.
I ordered a couple of sunblock protectors (Heliocare) and they are great! The purchase online was very easy and the delivery was right on time. I hardly recommend buying from them :)

review_title: I had a dissapointing experience at the?�?
review_body: I had a dissapointing experience at the skin clinic however my complaint regarding customer service was dealt with extremely well and it is clear that my experience was an isolated one.

review_title: Amazing experience and great laser results!
review_body: I?��m shocked to read some of the reviews.

review_title: I don't usually leave negative reviews?�?
review_body: I don't usually leave negative reviews but I had a terrible experience at the Milton Keynes Sk:N Clinics, received the worst customer service I've ever seen.

review_title: I felt as if I was being pushed and?�?
review_body: I felt as if I was being pushed and pressured into taking treatment during and after the consultation. I was also told it?��s best to get booked in even though I had already stated I would need time to get things sorted first.

review_body: The worst treatment I had dropping eyelids with botox

Trying to spend a thousand pounds on picosure tattoo removal but cannot get the branch to respond, contacted customer services twice to get answers to my queries but they also do not call me back. If this is the level of customer service that I should expect then I?��m taking my business elsewhere

Absolutely shocking experience. I signed up for an offer, had a consultation during which the lady said I could sign up 2 weeks after my holiday. They then disappeared, gave them a call and after 10 minutes on the phone looking for my records they said that the offer was no longer valid and wanted to give me another offer that would have cost me twice. This is very unprofessional and totally neglecting of customer care.
the service is great here, the girls are all really lovely and very professional
